item.title: Build CV template in Latex
item.description: Reference Blog How to write a LaTeX class file and design your own CV (Part 1) How did I design my CV in LaTeX Template: Awesome CV (github, overleaf) Load base class \LoadClass{ ... } So what has happened here? Class files need to contain a lot of formatting information and internal setup to make LaTeX work properly, but we don’t want to have to enter it all manually.

item.title: Latex note
item.description: Reference Overleaf getting started (link) Install Installing Latex on Window Install MiKTeX (link) Then install Latexmk (link) Intalling LaTeX-Workshop on VS Code Install Latex on Window follow Installing Latex on Window On VS Code, find the extension name LaTeX-Workshop or LaTeX-Workshop (link) Note: Recommend configure [latex-workshop.latex.autoClean.run](http://latex-workshop.latex.autoClean.run) to onBuilt for deleting all the redundant files after built. Some Notes Figure position parameters You can put more than one value in the parameter, for instance, if you write [ht] LATEX will try to position the figure here, but if it’s not possible (the space may be insufficient) then the figure will appear at the top of the page.

item.title: Hugo note
item.description: My note when working with Hugo. Install Hugo macOS Link Window Link Find the hugo_extended_<version_number>_Windows-64bit.zip and download. Unzip file and we have hugo.exe inside that folder. Assume the path of your folder is C:/hugo/file/hugo_extended_<version_number>_Windows-64bit Open Advanced system settings/Environment Variables Choose Path in System variables. Choose New and add the path of the unzip folder. Done Now you can run hugo in cmd. Create new post hugo new post/<title>/index.md

item.title: Adversarial Robustness as a Prior for Better Transfer Learning
item.description: TL:DR Using an Adversarial robustness model as a prior model for improving transfer learning. Ref Link: Adversarial robustness as a prior for better transfer learning Paper: Do Adversarially Robust ImageNet Models Transfer Better? Code Summary Overview Overview of Transfer Learning A depiction of transfer learning. Two common methods in transfer learning: Refining the ImageNet pretrained model can be done in several ways. In our work we focus on two common methods:

item.title: Cupper Shortcodes
item.description: blockquote {{< blockquote author="Carl Jung" >}} Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better to take things as they come along with patience and equanimity. {{< /blockquote >}} Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
